columns.comment: Primary key for this record

columns.comment: The observer to which this record applies

columns.name: observed_property_id
columns.comment: The observed parameter to which this record applies

columns.name: observing_method_id
columns.comment: Primary method/principles by which the sensor makes measurements

columns.name: measurement_units
columns.comment: The units used in this record

columns.name: drift_per_unit_time
columns.comment: Sensor drift per unit time, units specified by measurement units, unit time by unit time

columns.name: unit_time
columns.comment: Unit time for drift per unit time (seconds)

columns.name: valid_min
columns.comment: Minimum observable value by sensor, in units specificed by measurement units

columns.name: valid_max
columns.comment: Maximum observable value by sensor, in units specificed by measurement units

columns.name: measurement_uncertainty
columns.comment: Measurement uncertainty for measurements from this sensor, 2 sigma. Units as per measuremenet units

columns.name: measurement_accuracy
columns.comment: Measurement accuracy (trueness) for measurements from this sensor, 2 sigma. Units as per measuremenet units

columns.name: measurement_repeatability
columns.comment: Measurement repeatability (precision) for measurements from this sensor, 2 sigma. Units as per measuremenet units

columns.name: measurement_resolution
columns.comment: Minimum change detectable for measurements from this sensor. Units as per measurement units

columns.name: id
columns.comment: ID / primary key

columns.name: location
columns.comment: Location of observation

columns.name: elevation
columns.comment: Elevation of observation above mean sea level (in meters)

columns.name: observation_type_id
columns.comment: Type of observation

columns.name: phenomenon_start
columns.comment: Start time of the phenomenon being observed or observing period, if missing assumed instantaneous with time given by phenomenon_end

columns.name: phenomenon_end
columns.comment: End time of the phenomenon being observed or observing period

columns.name: result_value
columns.comment: The value of the result in float representation

columns.name: result_uom
columns.comment: Units used to represent the value being observed

columns.name: result_description
columns.comment: str representation of the result if applicable

columns.name: result_quality
columns.comment: JSON representation of the result quality, key / value pairs

columns.name: result_time
columns.comment: Time that the result became available

columns.name: valid_from
columns.comment: Time that the result starts to be valid

columns.name: valid_to
columns.comment: Time after which the result is no longer valid

columns.name: host_id
columns.comment: Host associated with making the observation, equivalent to OGC OMS 'host'

columns.name: observer_id
columns.comment: Observer associated with making the observation, equivalent to OGC OMS 'observer'

columns.name: observed_property_id
columns.comment: The phenomenon, or thing, being observed

columns.name: observing_procedure_id
columns.comment: Procedure used to make the observation

columns.name: collection_id
columns.comment: Primary collection or dataset that this observation belongs to. Note: this is different to the OGC OMS collection concept.

columns.name: parameter
columns.comment: List of key/ value pairs in dict

columns.name: feature_id
columns.comment: Feature of interest that this observation is associated with
